poem:
Title: Amidst London Shadows 

Against the will of ink,
a voice, subdued by scorn,
wears red upon London pavement.
Shadows over Tehran dance,
burdened by Yew's silence.
Threats echo, persist in the night,
upon a Persian tongue,
A lullaby too heavy for daylight.
Sorrow sings in the language of letters,
melancholy murmurs in the iris's heart,
Note, this morning, the quiet cry -
of violated parchment.
